hints.title: Encoding Format
hints.content: The hidden data is stored in binary format and encoded as ASCII text. The flag follows the standard HQX{...} format. The data is hidden in the Least Significant Bit (LSB) of each pixel's color channels.

hints.title: Extraction Tools
hints.content: You can use 'zsteg' (Ruby tool) for automated detection: 'zsteg mystery_image.png'. Alternatively, write a Python script using PIL/Pillow to extract the LSB from each RGB channel in order. The data is stored sequentially across pixels in row-major order (left-to-right, top-to-bottom).

hints.title: Complete Extraction Method
hints.content: Extract the LSB (rightmost bit) from each color channel in this order: R→G→B, processing pixels from left-to-right, top-to-bottom. Group the extracted bits into 8-bit bytes and convert to ASCII characters. The flag starts immediately at the beginning of the extracted data. An EOF marker (1111111111111110) signals the end of the hidden message. Python code: for each pixel (r,g,b): extract (r&1, g&1, b&1), combine bits, convert to chr(int(byte,2)).

progressive_hints.description: Hints unlock progressively to guide without spoiling the challenge
progressive_hints.hint_strategy: Start with concept understanding, move to tools, end with implementation details

hint_usage_guide.when_to_use_hint_1: If you don't understand what LSB steganography is or what to look for
hint_usage_guide.when_to_use_hint_2: If you know about LSB but don't know which tools or approach to use
hint_usage_guide.when_to_use_hint_3: If you're implementing extraction but getting incorrect results or need algorithm details

wrong_paths.why_wrong: The flag is not in metadata, it's in the pixel data itself
wrong_paths.redirect: Use hint 1 to understand LSB steganography

wrong_paths.approach: Looking for appended data with binwalk
wrong_paths.why_wrong: No files are appended after EOF, the data is embedded in pixels
wrong_paths.redirect: Use hint 2 to learn about proper extraction tools

wrong_paths.why_wrong: steghide doesn't support PNG format (only JPEG and BMP)
wrong_paths.redirect: Use hint 2 to find PNG-compatible tools like zsteg

wrong_paths.why_wrong: The data is in the Least Significant Bit (LSB), not Most Significant Bit (MSB)
wrong_paths.redirect: Use hint 3 for correct bit extraction method

learning_checkpoints.validation: Can explain why changing LSB doesn't visibly affect the image
Successfully runs zsteg and interprets output
Understands bit manipulation and byte conversion
